subject: Entrepreneurship
title: FOMO: The Real Engine of Fundraising
description: A micro-lesson that makes FOMO: The Real Engine of Fundraising usable.

hook.text: A startup with two competing term sheets raises at double the valuation. Nothing changed except demand.

buildup.text: FOMOâ€”fear of missing outâ€”drives VC behavior more than spreadsheets or logic.

discovery.text: Creating urgency and competitive tension is the #1 fundraising tactic used by the best founders.

twist.text: Manufactured FOMO backfires. VCs talk to each other. If you bluff, they'll find out.

climax.text: Real FOMO comes from genuine traction, a compelling story, and multiple investors circling.

punchline.text: Investors are rational until they think they'll miss the next big thing.

quiz.question: How does FOMO affect startup fundraising?
options: Competitive demand from multiple investors drives up valuations and speeds up decisions
It causes investors to skip due diligence entirely
It only affects inexperienced angel investors
